short_description: The PROGENy building block uses PROGENy to extract pathway activities from gene expression data. Further information on PROGENy can be found on the [Saez Laboratory website](https://saezlab.github.io/progeny/).
long_description: The PROGENy building block uses PROGENy to extract pathway activities from gene expression data. Further information on PROGENy can be found on the [Saez Laboratory website](https://saezlab.github.io/progeny/).

default.name: input_file
default.description: CSV with gene expression data, where rows are genes and columns are samples

default.name: ntop
default.description: Number of top genes used to estimate pathway activities

default.name: col_genes
default.description: Name of the column containing gene IDs

default.name: exclude_cols
default.description: Columns containing this string will be removed

default.name: perms
default.description: Number of permutations to estimate the null distribution. For default usage of PROGENy, just pass 1 to skip this step

default.name: zscore
default.description: If TRUE, the z-scores will be returned for the pathway activity estimations. Else, the function returns a normalized z-score value between -1 and 1

default.name: output_file
default.description: File with the results containing pathway activities
